testcase.purpose: Test checks that the current node is a template element, the element must be created with its ownerDocument set to the template contents owner of the ownerDocument of the template element
Test checks that the node must be appended to the template contents of the template element instead, whenever the HTML parser is about to append a node to a template element
Test checks that the conforming UA must clearing stack back to a table body context when popping elements from the stack of open elements
Test checks that the conforming UA must clearing stack back to a table context when popping elements from the stack of open elements
Test checks that the conforming UA must clearing stack back to a table row context when popping elements from the stack of open elements
Test checks that the last template element with a table element immediately below it, in the stack of open elements is the foster parent element that not the template parent
Test checks that the last template element without table element is below it, in the stack of open elements is the foster parent element that not the template parent
Test checks that regular rules of foster parenting should be applied when template element is higher in stack of open elements
Test checks that regular rules of foster parenting should be applied when template element is lower in stack of open elements
Test checks that the element should be ignored when template end tag without start one
Test checks that implied end tags should be generated when template end tag is met
Test checks that the implied end tags should be generated when template end tag is met in body insertion mode
Test checks that in body insertion mode parser should ignore BODY token when empty BODY element assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode parser should ignore BODY token not empty BODY element assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode parser should ignore BODY token when BODY element and some valid element after BODY tag assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode parser should ignore BODY token when BODY element and some valid element before BODY tag assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode parser should ignore BODY token when template with not empty BODY element inside assigned to another template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode parser should ignore BODY token when loading a HTML file with BODY tag inside template
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore FRAMESET token when FRAMESET element assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore FRAMESET token when FRAMESET element and some valid element before it, assigned to the template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore FRAMESET token when FRAMESET element and some valid element after it, assigned to the template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore FRAMESET token when FRAMESET tag inside template tag assigned to another template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore FRAMESET token when loading a HTML file with FRAMESET tag inside template
Test checks that In body insertion mode: parser should ignore HEAD token when empty HEAD element assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HEAD token when not empty HEAD element assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HEAD token when HEAD element and some valid element before it, assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HEAD token when HEAD element and some valid element after it, assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HEAD token when HEAD tag inside template tag assigned to another template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HEAD token when loading a HTML file with HEAD tag inside template
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HTML token when HTML element assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HTML token when HTML element and some valid element before it, assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HTML token when HEAD element and some valid element after it, assigned to template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HTML token when HTML tag inside template tag assigned to another template innerHTML
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HTML token when some valid element inside HTML element
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HTML token when valid element inside HTML and BODY elements
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HTML token when valid element inside and between HTML and BODY elements
Test checks that in body insertion mode: parser should ignore HTML token when loading a HTML file with HTML tag inside template
Test checks that the stack of open elements has a template element in html scope then ignore body element the token when fragment or template contents case
Test checks that parser in body insertion mode meets template end tag and if the stack of open elements has no template element in html scope, then this is a parse error, ignore the token
Test checks that in table insertion mode: ignore TABLE end tag when the stack of open elements does not have an element in table scope with the same tag name as the token
Test checks that all the children of template content are copied when copy children flag be set
Test checks that the template contents should be serialized instead of template element when the node is a template element
Test checks that the innerHTML of template element replaces all referenced by the content attribute when context object is an HTML Template Element
Test checks that the created node's node document must be set to that of the element to which it will be appended when the user agent creates a node for insertion to the DOM tree
Test checks that the template contents should be serialized instead of template element when the algorithm must produce a serialization of a template element
Test checks that the template contents must be a DocumentFragment whose node document is a template contents owner
Test checks that the template contents owner document type is HTML document when DOCUMENT has no browsing context
Test checks that the template element's content DocumentFragment must be adopted into the new node document template contents owner document when a template element's node document changes
Test checks that the template may contain any element, except the html element, the head element, the body element, or the frameset element
Test checks that the template element can be a descendant of the body element
Test checks that the template element can be a descendant of the frameset element
Test checks that the template element can be a descendant of the head element
Test checks that the template contents are hidden implicitly
Test checks that the template element itself must be hidden by default
